Author: Mylo#8306
Content: what happened to remote TUI?  now it looks like i need a config file in my python dreams

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
check what you're doing - looks like it's getting a lot more complex than just talking to RPC which just uses strings and numbers.

for instance, dumpprivkey using RPC returns a string. 

WIth pter todd's python library, wants to return a bitcoin.base58.CBase58Data or something i don't even want to know is compatible with some library i don't really want to maintain as a dApp developer.  https://github.com/petertodd/python-bitcoinlib/blob/master/bitcoin/wallet.py#L237

I just want to talk RPC to komodo interface over network.   simple auth, function(params) returns simple data of strings and numbers.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: you want to build a simple wrapper for RPC

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: e.g. https://github.com/peercoin/peercoin_rpc/blob/master/peercoin_rpc/peercoin_rpc.py

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
remove the need to read a file, you just want to configure RPC "on the fly" because the different ACs that will want to use oracles etc.

Other projects don't have this "on the fly" talk to ACs, which you identified as a problem configuring for each AC.

That's my 2c.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: https://gist.github.com/imylomylo/be68888807952c90a8fd3a970d5e2f2b

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Peercoin rpc only supports these methods https://github.com/peercoin/peercoin_rpc/blob/master/peercoin_rpc/peercoin_rpc.py so just expand on them for KMD RPC stuff.

Fork it and just put in your oractelist method.  it should work no dramas

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You can use komodo-cli to fetch the rpcport... Or you can read the .conf file to extract all needed data... I'm not so sure how easy it in in python but I have bash scripts where all I need to give it is the name of the ac... And everything works out of the boz

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: For a lot ofy stuff ATM, I'm using bash scripts to pass python scripts data or vice versa...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There seems to be no other simple wat to do it, and using already working code saves endless time.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yes simple wrapper to RPC in every language is preferable without reading a .conf file, just passing in user, pass, host:port.   it has less baggage than everything else for a 1st step of developer tools.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: nothing.  just don't hard code the path to remain flexible.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: is my request.  it will add unnecessary support questions

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: time wasted for developers if it needs to be in ~/.komodo/ACNAME/ACNAME.conf or equiv in other OSes

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: But for remote TUI, all is needed is pass in user/pass.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: the dApp devs can store their credentials. dictating where to store a config file by hard-coding the location limits the flexibility.  a web developer does not have access to the file system, has to pass in config params.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If your using a devoplemt chain, why not have the RPC/USER pass passed to the daemon on start, and have it write those to the file intead of random ones ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then you can use whatever you want, and know it will be correct

Content: need your logic help for tokenlist and tokeninfo saving in tmp/cache so that I don't query tokenlist/tokeninfo muultiple times so frequently.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@grewalsatinder Hey mate! https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/master/qa/rpc-tests/cryptoconditions.py#L283 here are tokenCC auto-tests
In gateways TUI I've only used tokencreate and tokenlist to printout list on screen

Not sure how it'll be on JS but in python to save tokenlist to file is like a 
```
tokenlist = rpc.tokenlist()
with open(newfile, 'a') as file:
    for token in tokenlist
    file.writelines(token + "\n")
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maybe store this file on server side with some updatable "tokens_amount" param?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
And from client side you'll check every X minutes if tokens_amount on client side < than tokens_amount on server side
If it's differ server give to client needed amount of lines and you append it to cache - should work since tokenids ordered in tokenlist (new ones append to the end)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So user will need to get only additional lines, not whole file

Content: I'm jusing key/value db

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I can do two ways:
- query tokenlist > update key `tokenlist` with it's array.
 - loop query this tokenlist array and store the info as a object under each hash array in this existing key.
 like
```{
  "tokenlist": [
    {"hash1": "tokeninfo_as_value_to_it"},
    {"hash2": "tokeninfo_as_value_to_it"},
    {"hash3": "tokeninfo_as_value_to_it"},
  ]
}```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: or just save each separately.
